get.description: Returns name, code, and ID (`cloudletId`) information for all available Cloudlets. You need the `cloudletId` when creating a new policy.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Cloudlets API

200.description: Returns details for Cloudlets that you can [create a policy](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloudlets/reference/post-policy) for, including the Cloudlet's name and code.

schema.description: Returns name, code, and ID information for a specific type of Cloudlet. You need the `cloudletId` when creating a new policy.

items.description: Returns details of a Cloudlet that you can [create a policy for](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloudlets/reference/post-policy), including a Cloudlet name and Cloudlet code.

apiVersion.description: The specific version of this API.

cloudletCode.description: The type of Cloudlet that this policy is for. To see the available Cloudlets, run the [List Cloudlets](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloudlets/reference/get-cloudlets) operation. Possible values include: `ALB` for Application Load Balancer, `AP` for API Prioritization, `AS` for Audience Segmentation, `CD` for Phased Release, `ER` for Edge Redirector, `FR` for Forward Rewrite, `IG` for Request Control, and `VP` for Visitor Prioritization.

cloudletId.description: The ID of cloudlet that this policy is for. The `cloudletId` for Edge Redirector is `0`, Visitor Prioritization is `1`, Forward Rewrite is `3`, Request Control is `4`, API Prioritization is `5`, Audience Segmentation is `6`, Phased Release is `7`, and Application Load Balancer is `9`. To see the available Cloudlets, run the [List Cloudlets](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloudlets/reference/get-cloudlets) operation.

cloudletName.description: The name of Cloudlet that this policy is for. To see the available Cloudlets, run the [List Cloudlets](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloudlets/reference/get-cloudlets) operation. Available options are `APPLICATIONLOADBALANCER`, `ASSETPRIORITIZATION` for API Prioritization, `AUDIENCESEGMENTATION`, `CONTINUOUSDEPLOYMENT` for Phased Release, `EDGEREDIRECTOR`, `FORWARDREWRITE`, `IPGEOACCESS` for Request Control, and `VISITORPRIORITIZATION`.

location.description: The navigable endpoint used for the object referred to in the operation.

serviceVersion.description: The build of the software running on the server.

post.description: Activate the selected load balancing version. The load balancing version status is either `active` or `inactive`.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Cloudlets API

dryrun.description: If `true`, the operation validates the configuration, but does not activate the load balancing version. The default setting is `false`.

network.description: The network, either `STAGING`, `PRODUCTION`, or `prod` as shorthand, on which a load balancing configuration for Application Load Balancer has been activated. Values are case-insensitive in requests.

version.description: The version number of the activated load balancing configuration.

200.description: Schema for a load balancer activation.

activatedBy.description: The name of the user who activated the load balancing configuration.

activatedDate.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, on which the load balancing configuration was activated.

dryrun.description: If `true`, the operation validates the configuration, but does not activate the load balancing version. The default setting is `false`.

network.description: The network, either `STAGING`, `PRODUCTION`, or `prod` as shorthand, on which a load balancing configuration for Application Load Balancer has been activated. Values are case-insensitive in requests.

status.description: The activation status for the load balancing version. Values include the following: `inactive` where the load balancing version has not been activated. No active property versions reference this policy. `active` where the load balancing version is currently active (published) and its associated property version is also active. `deactivated` where the load balancing version was previously activated but it has been superseded by a more recent activation of another load balancing version. `pending` where the load balancing version is proceeding through the activation workflow. `failed` where the activation workflow for the load balancing version has failed.

version.description: The version number of the activated load balancing configuration.

parameters.description: Set `async` to `true` for policy activations on multiple properties to reduce API response time and let the policy activation continue asynchronously in the background. Default is `false`.
parameters.name: async

post.description: You can create multiple versions of the load balancing configuration. By versioning these settings, you can test new configurations, or manage changes to the data centers supporting Application Load Balancer.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Cloudlets API

balancingType.description: The type of load balancing being performed. Options include `WEIGHTED` and `PERFORMANCE`.

dataCenters.description: The object containing information on conditional origins being used as data centers for an Application Load Balancer implementation, as detailed [below](#datacenters). Only conditional origins with an `originType` of `CUSTOMER` or `NETSTORAGE` can be used as data centers in an Application Load Balancer configuration.

items.description: Contains information about the data centers where the origins are located.

city.description: The city in which the data center is located.

cloudServerHostHeaderOverride.description: When set to `true`, overides the host header for load balancing in a cloud environment.

cloudService.description: If `true` caching for the data center is updated at a certain interval, like it would for a cloud-based service.

continent.description: The continent on which the data center is located. See [Continent Codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/continentCodes.csv) for a list of valid codes.

country.description: The country in which the data center is located. See [Country Codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/cc2continent.csv) for a list of valid codes.

hostname.description: The name of the host that can be used as a conditional origin.

latitude.description: The latitude value for the data center. This member supports six decimal places of precision.

livenessHosts.description: An array of strings that represent the origin servers used to poll the data centers in an Application Load Balancer configuration. These servers support basic HTTP polling.

longitude.description: The longitude value for the data center. This member supports six decimal places of precision.

percent.description: The percent of traffic that is sent to the data center. The total for all `dataCenters` objects within the array must equal 100%.

stateOrProvince.description: The state, province, or region where the data center is located. See [region codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/region_codes.txt).

deleted.description: If `true`, the conditional origin version has been deleted. If you set this member to `false`, you can use this version again.

description.description: The description of the load balancing configuration provided by a user.

livenessSettings.description: The object containing information on the liveness settings for an Application Load Balancer implementation, as detailed [below](#livenesssettings).

balancingType.description: The type of load balancing being performed. Options include `WEIGHTED` and `PERFORMANCE`.

createdBy.description: The name of the user who created this load balancing configuration.

createdDate.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when this load balancing configuration was created.

dataCenters.description: The object containing information on conditional origins being used as data centers for an Application Load Balancer implementation, as detailed [below](#datacenters). Only conditional origins with an `originType` of `CUSTOMER` or `NETSTORAGE` can be used as data centers in an Application Load Balancer configuration.

balancingType.description: The type of load balancing being performed. Options include `WEIGHTED` and `PERFORMANCE`.

createdBy.description: The name of the user who created this load balancing configuration.

createdDate.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when this load balancing configuration was created.

dataCenters.description: The object containing information on conditional origins being used as data centers for an Application Load Balancer implementation. Only conditional origins with an `originType` of `CUSTOMER` or `NETSTORAGE` can be used as data centers in an Application Load Balancer configuration.

items.description: Contains information about the data centers where the origins are located.

city.description: The city in which the data center is located.

cloudServerHostHeaderOverride.description: When set to `true`, overides the host header for load balancing in a cloud environment.

cloudService.description: If `true` caching for the data center is updated at a certain interval, like it would for a cloud-based service.

continent.description: The continent on which the data center is located. See [Continent Codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/continentCodes.csv) for a list of valid codes.

country.description: The country in which the data center is located. See [Country Codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/cc2continent.csv) for a list of valid codes.

hostname.description: The name of the host that can be used as a conditional origin.

latitude.description: The latitude value for the data center. This member supports six decimal places of precision.

livenessHosts.description: An array of strings that represent the origin servers used to poll the data centers in an Application Load Balancer configuration. These servers support basic HTTP polling.

longitude.description: The longitude value for the data center. This member supports six decimal places of precision.

percent.description: The percent of traffic that is sent to the data center. The total for all `dataCenters` objects within the array must equal 100%.

stateOrProvince.description: The state, province, or region where the data center is located. See [region codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/region_codes.txt).

deleted.description: If `true`, the conditional origin version has been deleted. If you set this member to `false`, you can use this version again.

description.description: The description of the load balancing configuration provided by a user.

immutable.description: Indicates whether you can edit the load balancing version. The default setting is `false`. It automatically becomes `true` when the load balancing version is activated for the first time.

lastModifiedBy.description: The user who last modified the load balancing configuration.

lastModifiedDate.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the initial load balancing configuration was last modified.

livenessSettings.description: The object containing information on the liveness settings for an Application Load Balancer implementation.

version.description: The version number of the activated load balancing configuration.

warnings.description: Provides error response data to help diagnose the problem that led to the error.

items.description: Provides error response data to help diagnose the problem that led to the error.

detail.description: Provides actionable instructions to diagnose the problem that caused the error.

errors.description: Error objects that provide information for debugging.

get.summary: Get associated properties for a policy

200.description: Returns information about the associated properties.

schema.description: Contains information about the newest property version and the propertys current configuration on the production and staging networks for a specific `policyId`.

groupId.description: The group association for the property.

name.description: The name of the property. This value also appears at the start of each separate property object.

newestVersion.description: Contains information about the newest property version.

items.description: Contains information about the newest property version and the propertys current configuration on the production and staging networks for a specific `policyId`.

activatedBy.description: The name of the user who activated property.

activationDate.description: The date, in ISO 8601 format indicating when the property was activated.

cloudletsOrigins.description: Contains information about each conditional origin.

checksum.description: The checksum that distinguishes this conditional origin from any others that might share the same name.

description.description: The description of the load balancing configuration provided by a user.

type.description: The type of origin this conditional origin is set up as. In this response the conditonal origin `type` is `APPLICATION_LOAD_BALANCER`.

checksum.description: The checksum that distinguishes this conditional origin from any others that might share the same name.

hostname.description: The name of the host that can be used as a conditional origin.

type.description: The type of origin this conditional origin is set up as, in this case `CUSTOMER`.

checksum.description: The checksum that distinguishes this conditional origin from any others that might share the same name.

hostname.description: The name of the host that can be used as a conditional origin.

type.description: The type of origin this conditional origin is set up as, in this case `NETSTORAGE`.

referencedPolicies.description: The names of Cloudlets policies for this version of the property.

post.description: Create a new policy version, where the version number will be incremented from the highest existing version.  With this operation you can change any modifiable policy or version attributes.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Cloudlets API

example.description: Testing the cloning of a policy

description.description: Description of the policy version.

matchRules.description: A list of Cloudlet-specific match rules for this policy.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Application Load Balancer.
oneOf.title: Application Load Balancer

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `end` value in epoch seconds.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, `pathAndQS`, and `useIncomingQueryString`.

pathAndQS.description: If a value is provided and match conditions are met, this is the URL path to rewrite the incoming request's URL. The URL may include additional query parameters.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple`, `range`, and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on. Use `range` when the match is true for incoming requests within an inclusive range of two numbers.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: When setting up a range match, enter the two numbers that comprise the range. If the value assigned to an incoming request falls within this inclusive range, the match is true. The specified `range` needs to be a percentage from 1 to 100.
oneOf.title: Range

value.description: An inclusive range comprised of two numbers to match on.

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use this for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` or `range` match value subtypes, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule is always on when `true`. When `false`, the rule is applied according to the `start` and `end` times.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Application Load Balancer is `albMatchRule`.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Edge Redirector is `erMatchRule`.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple`, `range`, and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on. Use `range` when the match is true for incoming requests within an inclusive range of two numbers.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: When setting up a range match, enter the two numbers that comprise the range. If the value assigned to an incoming request falls within this inclusive range, the match is true. The specified `range` needs to be a percentage from 1 to 100.
oneOf.title: Range

value.description: An inclusive range comprised of two numbers to match on.

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use the `objectMatchValueObjectSubtype` for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` or `range` match value subtypes, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule is always on when `true`. When `false`, the rule is applied according to the `start` and `end` times.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Forward Rewrite is `frMatchRule`.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Request Control.
oneOf.title: Request Control

allowDeny.description: If set to `allow`, the request is sent to origin when all conditions are true. If `deny`, the request is denied when all conditions are true. If `denybranded`, the request is denied and rerouted according to the configuration of the [Request Control behavior](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-request-control).

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `end` value in epoch seconds.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

passThroughPercent.description: The range `0.000: 99.000` specifies the percentage of requests that pass through to the origin. The value of `100` means the request always passes through to the origin. For Visitor Prioritization, a value of `-1` means send everyone to the waiting room.

201.description: Returns details of a policy version.

example.description: Testing the cloning of a policy

activations.description: List of activations related to the policy version.

items.description: Returns details of a policy activation.

apiVersion.description: The specific version of this API.

network.description: The network, either `STAGING`, `PRODUCTION`, or `prod` as shorthand, on which a load balancing configuration for Application Load Balancer has been activated. Values are case-insensitive in requests.

policyInfo.description: Returns details of a policy associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

propertyInfo.description: Returns details of a property associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

groupId.description: Identifies the group where the property is placed.

serviceVersion.description: __Deprecated__ The build of the software running on the server. The value can be `null`.

createDate.description: Date of the policy version creation in milliseconds.

createdBy.description: User name who created the policy version.

deleted.description: Flag determining whether the policy version is deleted or not.

description.description: Description of the policy version.

lastModifiedBy.description: User name who recently modified the policy version.

lastModifiedDate.description: Date of the recent policy version modification in milliseconds.

location.description: The navigable endpoint used for the object referred to in the operation.

matchRules.description: A list of Cloudlet-specific match rules for this policy.

value.description: An inclusive range comprised of two numbers to match on.

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use this for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` or `range` match value subtypes, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule is always on when `true`. When `false`, the rule is applied according to the `start` and `end` times.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Phased Release is `cdMatchRule`.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Edge Redirector.
oneOf.title: Edge Redirector

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `end` value in epoch seconds.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple`, `range`, and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on. Use `range` when the match is true for incoming requests within an inclusive range of two numbers.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Edge Redirector is `erMatchRule`.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

policyId.description: ID of the policy the version is associated to.

rulesLocked.description: Flag determining whether the rules are locked or not.

parameters.description: If cloning an existing policy version, this parameter value is the number of the policy version you want to clone. If there are attributes that you do _not_ want propagated from the source policy version, you must provide the new values in the request.
parameters.name: cloneVersion

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

get.description: Returns information about all versions of a policy.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Cloudlets API

200.description: Returns all policy versions.

activations.description: List of activations related to the policy version.

items.description: Returns details of a policy activation.

apiVersion.description: The specific version of this API.

network.description: The network, either `STAGING`, `PRODUCTION`, or `prod` as shorthand, on which a load balancing configuration for Application Load Balancer has been activated. Values are case-insensitive in requests.

policyInfo.description: Returns details of a policy associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

propertyInfo.description: Returns details of a property associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

groupId.description: Identifies the group where the property is placed.

serviceVersion.description: __Deprecated__ The build of the software running on the server. The value can be `null`.

createDate.description: Date of the policy version creation in milliseconds.

createdBy.description: User name who created the policy version.

deleted.description: Flag determining whether the policy version is deleted or not.

description.description: Description of the policy version.

lastModifiedBy.description: User name who recently modified the policy version.

lastModifiedDate.description: Date of the recent policy version modification in milliseconds.

location.description: The navigable endpoint used for the object referred to in the operation.

matchRules.description: A list of Cloudlet-specific match rules for this policy.

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple`, `range`, and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on. Use `range` when the match is true for incoming requests within an inclusive range of two numbers.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: When setting up a range match, enter the two numbers that comprise the range. If the value assigned to an incoming request falls within this inclusive range, the match is true. The specified `range` needs to be a percentage from 1 to 100.
oneOf.title: Range

value.description: An inclusive range comprised of two numbers to match on.

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use this for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` or `range` match value subtypes, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule is always on when `true`. When `false`, the rule is applied according to the `start` and `end` times.

passThroughPercent.description: The percentage of requests that pass through to the origin, with `100` indicating the request always passes through to the origin. For Visitor Prioritization, a value of -1 sends everyone to the waiting room.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for API Prioritization is `apMatchRule`.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Audience Segmentation.
oneOf.title: Audience Segmentation

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `end` value in epoch seconds.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, `pathAndQS`, and `useIncomingQueryString`.

pathAndQS.description: If a value is provided and match conditions are met, this is the URL path to rewrite the incoming request's URL. The URL may include additional query parameters.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule is always on when `true`. When `false`, the rule is applied according to the `start` and `end` times.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Edge Redirector is `erMatchRule`.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

value.description: If using the `simple` or `range` match value subtypes, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule is always on when `true`. When `false`, the rule is applied according to the `start` and `end` times.

passThroughPercent.description: The range `0.000: 99.000` specifies the percentage of requests that pass through to the origin. The value of `100` means the request always passes through to the origin. For Visitor Prioritization, a value of `-1` means send everyone to the waiting room.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Visitor Prioritization is `vpMatchRule`.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the request's query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

policyId.description: ID of the policy the version is associated to.

rulesLocked.description: Flag determining whether the rules are locked or not.

parameters.description: Including match rules for all policy versions in the results is now disabled. You can get match rules for a single policy version using [Get a Policy Version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloudlets/v2/reference/get-policy-version).
parameters.name: includeRules

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

parameters.description: The ID of the policy.
parameters.name: policyId

get.description: Returns information about a specific Cloudlet policy version.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Cloudlets API

200.description: Returns details of a policy version.

activations.description: List of activations related to the policy version.

items.description: Returns details of a policy activation.

apiVersion.description: The specific version of this API.

network.description: The network, either `STAGING`, `PRODUCTION`, or `prod` as shorthand, on which a load balancing configuration for Application Load Balancer has been activated. Values are case-insensitive in requests.

policyInfo.description: Returns details of a policy associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

propertyInfo.description: Returns details of a property associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

groupId.description: Identifies the group where the property is placed.

serviceVersion.description: __Deprecated__ The build of the software running on the server. The value can be `null`.

createDate.description: Date of the policy version creation in milliseconds.

createdBy.description: User name who created the policy version.

deleted.description: Flag determining whether the policy version is deleted or not.

description.description: Description of the policy version.

lastModifiedBy.description: User name who recently modified the policy version.

lastModifiedDate.description: Date of the recent policy version modification in milliseconds.

location.description: The navigable endpoint used for the object referred to in the operation.

matchRules.description: A list of Cloudlet-specific match rules for this policy.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Application Load Balancer.
oneOf.title: Application Load Balancer

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `end` value in epoch seconds.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, `pathAndQS`, and `useIncomingQueryString`.

pathAndQS.description: If a value is provided and match conditions are met, this is the URL path to rewrite the incoming request's URL. The URL may include additional query parameters.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple`, `range`, and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on. Use `range` when the match is true for incoming requests within an inclusive range of two numbers.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: When setting up a range match, enter the two numbers that comprise the range. If the value assigned to an incoming request falls within this inclusive range, the match is true. The specified `range` needs to be a percentage from 1 to 100.
oneOf.title: Range

value.description: An inclusive range comprised of two numbers to match on.

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule is always on when `true`. When `false`, the rule is applied according to the `start` and `end` times.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Edge Redirector is `erMatchRule`.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple`, `range`, and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on. Use `range` when the match is true for incoming requests within an inclusive range of two numbers.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: When setting up a range match, enter the two numbers that comprise the range. If the value assigned to an incoming request falls within this inclusive range, the match is true. The specified `range` needs to be a percentage from 1 to 100.
oneOf.title: Range

value.description: An inclusive range comprised of two numbers to match on.

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use the `objectMatchValueObjectSubtype` for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` or `range` match value subtypes, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule is always on when `true`. When `false`, the rule is applied according to the `start` and `end` times.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Forward Rewrite is `frMatchRule`.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Request Control.
oneOf.title: Request Control

allowDeny.description: If set to `allow`, the request is sent to origin when all conditions are true. If `deny`, the request is denied when all conditions are true. If `denybranded`, the request is denied and rerouted according to the configuration of the [Request Control behavior](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-request-control).

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `end` value in epoch seconds.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the request's query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

policyId.description: ID of the policy the version is associated to.

rulesLocked.description: Flag determining whether the rules are locked or not.

parameters.description: Excludes the match rules from the results. Defaults to `false`.
parameters.name: omitRules

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).

put.description: Update attributes of an existing policy version.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, `pathAndQS`, and `useIncomingQueryString`.

oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use this for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` or `range` match value subtypes, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule is always on when `true`. When `false`, the rule is applied according to the `start` and `end` times.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Phased Release is `cdMatchRule`.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Edge Redirector.
oneOf.title: Edge Redirector

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `end` value in epoch seconds.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple`, `range`, and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on. Use `range` when the match is true for incoming requests within an inclusive range of two numbers.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: When setting up a range match, enter the two numbers that comprise the range. If the value assigned to an incoming request falls within this inclusive range, the match is true. The specified `range` needs to be a percentage from 1 to 100.

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule is always on when `true`. When `false`, the rule is applied according to the `start` and `end` times.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Edge Redirector is `erMatchRule`.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

end.description: The end time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `end` value in epoch seconds.

200.description: Returns details of a policy version.

activations.description: List of activations related to the policy version.

items.description: Returns details of a policy activation.

apiVersion.description: The specific version of this API.

network.description: The network, either `STAGING`, `PRODUCTION`, or `prod` as shorthand, on which a load balancing configuration for Application Load Balancer has been activated. Values are case-insensitive in requests.

policyInfo.description: Returns details of a policy associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

propertyInfo.description: Returns details of a property associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

groupId.description: Identifies the group where the property is placed.

serviceVersion.description: __Deprecated__ The build of the software running on the server. The value can be `null`.

createDate.description: Date of the policy version creation in milliseconds.

createdBy.description: User name who created the policy version.

deleted.description: Flag determining whether the policy version is deleted or not.

description.description: Description of the policy version.

lastModifiedBy.description: User name who recently modified the policy version.

lastModifiedDate.description: Date of the recent policy version modification in milliseconds.

location.description: The navigable endpoint used for the object referred to in the operation.

matchRules.description: A list of Cloudlet-specific match rules for this policy.

value.description: If using the `simple` or `range` match value subtypes, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule is always on when `true`. When `false`, the rule is applied according to the `start` and `end` times.

passThroughPercent.description: The percentage of requests that pass through to the origin, with `100` indicating the request always passes through to the origin. For Visitor Prioritization, a value of -1 sends everyone to the waiting room.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for API Prioritization is `apMatchRule`.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Audience Segmentation.
oneOf.title: Audience Segmentation

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `end` value in epoch seconds.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, `pathAndQS`, and `useIncomingQueryString`.

pathAndQS.description: If a value is provided and match conditions are met, this is the URL path to rewrite the incoming request's URL. The URL may include additional query parameters.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple`, `range`, and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on. Use `range` when the match is true for incoming requests within an inclusive range of two numbers.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: When setting up a range match, enter the two numbers that comprise the range. If the value assigned to an incoming request falls within this inclusive range, the match is true. The specified `range` needs to be a percentage from 1 to 100.
oneOf.title: Range

value.description: An inclusive range comprised of two numbers to match on.

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use the `objectMatchValueObjectSubtype` for more complex match criteria.

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule is always on when `true`. When `false`, the rule is applied according to the `start` and `end` times.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule. When `matchesAlways` is `false`, enter the `start` value in epoch seconds.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Edge Redirector is `erMatchRule`.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Visitor Prioritization is `vpMatchRule`.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the request's query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

policyId.description: ID of the policy the version is associated to.

rulesLocked.description: Flag determining whether the rules are locked or not.

additionalPropertyNames.description: An array of one or more additional properties that you want to activate with the Cloudlet policy. Once activated, the property and policy are permanently linked.

network.description: The network, either `STAGING`, `PRODUCTION`, or `prod` as shorthand, on which a load balancing configuration for Application Load Balancer has been activated. Values are case-insensitive in requests.

200.description: Returns the activation history for the policy.

items.description: Returns details of a policy activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.
